review: I replaced my HTPC with this and it does what it is supposed to do. No issues connecting to my network and streams beautifully both with Netflix and Plex.  Could use DLNA support and I hope they add it (main reason for 4 instead of 5 stars).  More games and apps being added all the time so I feel this will just get better.  The box itself and remote feel very solid and not cheap.  Voice search does work well but limited at this time in what it can find (7/25/14) although I have already read that they are working to expand its capabilities.

review: Amazon Fire TV has a limited selection of apps from which to choose.  The feature where you speak into the remote to find a show works well but only within the Amazon site. My thought is that it is a better deal for Amazon than for customers. Overall, I prefer the Roku by a wide margin because the universe of apps is available.
author: shaleg

review: Where to begin, First of all I didn't want to buy a Smart TV because the TV I have now I LOVE!! I got the Fire TV and lets just say its nothing short of amazing!! First off the packaging was very nice, it was practical! I love the size of the unit itself. It is quite small and able to fit just about anywhere! I remote is very small and sleek, and resembles an Apple TV remote, BUT BETTER!! I have tested the voice search function and have yet to stump it!! I do wish that they would have included an HDMI cable, so that it was ready out of the box!!Now to the functionality:When they say its fast, they aren't kidding. The only issue I have EVER had was the Netflix app. At times its fast as can be..load times in around 5 seconds. Other times it can be 2-3 minutes and extremely pixelated! It's crazy how it fluctuates. I do wish that they include a section for just Prime videos. Seems like when I go to a genre and I want a movie, it is one I have to pay for!!Would I recommend? HECK YES!! I love this box, and use it almost daily. If you want a great alternative to smart tv then this is for you!!
